items.title: At Rs 1.92 lakh crore, fertiliser subsidy bill for FY26 may be 15% more than BE
items.summary: India's fertilizer subsidy bill is projected to reach ₹1.92 lakh crore this financial year. This increase stems from higher global prices for urea and diammonium phosphate, coupled with a dip in domestic production. The government aims to ensure farmers receive adequate fertilizer, shielding them from international price hikes.

items.title: Mittal-HPCL JV halts Russian oil purchases after fresh sanctions
items.summary: HMEL has stopped buying Russian oil due to new Western sanctions. The company stated it cannot confirm past deliveries involving sanctioned ships. HMEL buys crude on a delivered-at-port basis. This means they are unaware of earlier transport details. Top refiners Indian Oil and Reliance Industries are also complying with sanctions.

items.title: Revised ethics code to allow auditors to showcase services; ICAI also suggests fresh guidelines on audit independence
items.summary: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India is set to significantly update its Code of Ethics. New rules will allow auditors and their firms to advertise more freely and develop websites to showcase services. Stricter guidelines on audit independence are also proposed, aiming to reduce conflicts of interest for listed companies.

items.title: Telcos begin pilot runs of 'calling name presentation' feature in one circle
items.summary: Telecom operators are piloting a new feature called Calling Name Presentation. This will allow users to see a caller's name on incoming calls. The Department of Telecom expects this service to be available across India by March 31, 2026. This initiative aims to combat fraud and cybercrime by using verified caller information.

items.title: Bizman buys four flats at DLF’s The Dahlias for Rs 380 crore in record deal
items.summary: An industrialist has acquired four interconnected apartments at DLF's The Dahlias for nearly Rs 380 crore, marking one of the country's most expensive apartment deals. This transaction, totaling over 35,000 sq ft, highlights Gurugram's rising real estate prices, now rivaling and sometimes exceeding prime Mumbai locations. The project has seen significant sales, with prices appreciating by 50% since its launch.

items.title: Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa drives global overhaul, bets big on India
items.summary: Nissan is set for a major comeback in India. CEO Ivan Espinosa is spearheading a global overhaul, with India playing a crucial role. The company plans to launch three new models starting early 2026. This move aims to boost sales beyond the Magnite SUV. Nissan is also exploring collaborations with Honda for software and vehicle development.

items.title: Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa drives global overhaul, bets big on India
items.summary: Nissan is set for a major comeback in India. CEO Ivan Espinosa is spearheading a global overhaul, with India playing a crucial role. The company plans to launch three new models starting early 2026. This move aims to boost sales beyond the Magnite SUV. Nissan is also exploring collaborations with Honda for software and vehicle development.

items.title: Mobile verification platform to boost telcos revenues
items.summary: The government is gearing up to introduce a revolutionary platform that enables banks and financial providers to validate mobile numbers effectively. This initiative is a proactive measure aimed at curbing online frauds, especially phishing attacks. Each verification request will see telecom operators earning a fee, creating a win-win situation.

items.title: Microsoft admits configuration error caused worldwide Azure outage — Are services back?
items.summary: Microsoft confirmed that a configuration change error triggered a major outage on October 29, disrupting Azure, Microsoft 365, Outlook, Xbox Live, and Copilot worldwide. The company has begun deploying a “last known good” configuration to restore services, with early signs of recovery reported.

items.title: $21 bn & counting: CPPIB's India game moving at a faster click
items.summary: CPP Investments' India portfolio has tripled to nearly $21 billion. India is now its third-largest Asian market. The fund is exploring new infrastructure like green ammonia and EVs. CPP Investments is focused on long-term fundamentals. It sees significant opportunities in India's dynamic economy. The fund aims to deliver strong returns and build lasting partnerships.

items.title: Beyond Assembly: India's telecom manufacturing bets on design, AI
items.summary: India's telecommunications landscape is undergoing a transformative leap, moving away from simple assembly lines to crafting original designs and cutting-edge AI technologies. Backed by government incentives, this evolution promotes local production and innovation, aiming to lessen dependency on imports while pursuing opportunities in global markets.

items.title: Crash probe doesn't indicate any fault with the aircraft: Air India chief
items.summary: Air India's CEO Campbell Wilson stated preliminary findings on the Ahmedabad plane crash show no issues with the aircraft, engines, or airline practices. The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's interim report noted fuel switches were disengaged post-takeoff. Air India is cooperating with investigators and providing extensive support to victims' families. The airline is committed to assisting those affected.

items.title: Suzuki sells Indian curries in Japan!
items.summary: Suzuki Motor Corporation has taken a delicious detour into the culinary world by launching Indian curries in Japan. What started as a creative project among Indian engineers has now captivated Japanese engineers who have worked in India as well.

items.title: Year-end holidays are on us and early birds can't wait!
Drug cos forging data for approval, mislabelling brands to be barred
items.summary: In a bold move to combat deception in the pharmaceutical industry, the government is instituting strict penalties for drugmakers caught submitting forged or misleading documents during the approval process. This initiative is a direct response to the tragic incidents of child fatalities linked to tainted cough syrups.

items.title: Varun Beverages inks distribution pact with Carlsberg for African markets
items.summary: In a strategic move, Varun Beverages, the bottling partner for PepsiCo India, has clinched an exclusive distribution agreement with Carlsberg Breweries targeting the vibrant African markets. Meanwhile, the company is ambitiously looking into alcoholic beverage opportunities both domestically and on a global scale. Recently, VBL has reported a surge in profits fueled by reduced finance costs and advantageous currency shifts.

items.title: Exemptions to night duty rules ensure viable operations while maintaining safety: DGCA
items.summary: The civil aviation regulator had last year made the night-duty rules for pilots stringent. It amended the definition of night hours, extending the period by an hour—from midnight to 6 AM instead of 5 AM—and capped the number of landings a pilot can do during this period to two. It also limited the duty period to 10 hours.

items.title: The path is tough, but Maruti is on its way: Suzuki president
items.summary: Suzuki Motor Corp plans to reclaim its 50% share of India's passenger vehicle market by 2030. The company will introduce eight new SUVs in the coming years. Maruti Suzuki will also focus on small cars and expand its multi-fuel strategy with nine biogas plants. This initiative supports cleaner energy solutions and India's energy transition.

items.title: India ends duty-free imports of yellow peas
items.summary: From Nov 1, the pulse will attract 10 per cent tariff plus 20 per cent agri infra development cess

items.title: India, Nepal sign pact to develop power lines
items.summary: In a significant step towards sustainable development, India and Nepal have strengthened their energy partnership. Newly established power transmission lines will unite the two countries, enhancing electricity trade and ensuring stability in the regional grid.

items.title: Another US sanctions waiver for Iran port boosts India's Afghanistan plan
items.summary: India has secured an important extension from the US for the sanctions waiver regarding Chabahar Port, now valid until early next year. This port plays a pivotal role in enhancing India's connectivity with Afghanistan and Central Asia, ensuring ongoing operations that bolster India's strategic alliances in the area.

items.title: HCL co-founder Ajai Chowdhry urges adopting "demand aggression" model for Made in India push
items.summary: In a dynamic push for India's tech sector, Ajai Chowdhry, co-founder of HCL, champions the idea of demand aggregation for telecom and networking solutions. His call for the government to consolidate and award major contracts to top-tier Indian companies mirrors the successful model of China's Huawei.

items.title: India's soybean meal exports fall by 11% due to high prices
items.summary: Indian soybean meal exports have experienced a notable decline, with international demand waning by 11 percent during the oil marketing year 2024-25. The primary contributor to this downturn is the elevated pricing compared to global rivals. Germany, France, Nepal, Bangladesh, and Kenya led the charge in imports, showcasing shifting dynamics that could affect India's standing in the international market.

items.title: Founders of these $100 million startups all have a Delhi school's computer science club in common — can you guess?
items.summary: Deedy Das, partner at Menlo Ventures noted that founders of over $100 million valuation companies, including Snapdeal, boAt, Sugar Cosmetics, and Cartesia, were all members DPS RK Puram's computer science club, called Exun Clan.

items.title: LIC Housing Finance Q2 profit up 2% to  ₹1,354 crore; NPAs decline to 2.51%
items.summary: LIC Housing Finance reported a 2% increase in Q3 net profit to  ₹1,354 crore, with total income rising to  ₹7,170 crore. NPAs improved, reducing to 2.51%, while liquidity coverage ratio fell to 185.86%. Consolidated profit also saw a 1.5% rise to  ₹1,349 crore.

items.title: Sundaram Home optimistic of achieving strong growth in second half of FY26
items.summary: Sundaram Home Finance anticipates robust growth in the latter half of the financial year. The company is expanding its Emerging Business segment into more towns. This segment focuses on small loans up to Rs 20 lakh. Disbursements in this area have seen significant growth. The company is also entering the Karnataka market.

items.title: Key API unit of Granules in Hyderabad gets VAI tag from U.S. FDA
Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC to raise Rs 1,500 cr through realty credit fund
items.summary: Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC is launching a Rs 1,500 crore alternative investment fund, ABRECOF-II, to provide senior secured loans to real estate projects. The fund targets predictable, risk-adjusted returns with strong downside protection, focusing on post-approval, brownfield projects by established developers in major Indian cities. It aims for a gross IRR of 16-18% with quarterly coupon payouts.

items.title: Microsoft Azure down: What caused the outage? Which services are affected?
items.summary: A DNS failure in Azure Front Door triggered widespread outages across Azure Portal, Outlook, Xbox multiplayer, and other Microsoft 365 services. Microsoft is investigating and offering temporary workarounds as recovery continues.

items.title: India considering $12 billion plan to bail out State power distributors
items.summary: The plan marks Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s toughest reform push yet to overhaul the chronically inefficient state-run electricity distribution companies, seen as the weakest link in India’s energy chain

items.title: L&T appoints Amitabh Kant as independent director
items.summary: Larsen & Toubro has appointed Amitabh Kant as a non-executive, independent director. This appointment is for a term of five years. Kant previously served as G20 Sherpa and NITI Aayog CEO. He also recently joined HCL Technologies and IndiGo boards. This marks a new chapter for the veteran administrator after 45 years in government service.

items.title: DGCA cites operational stability, regional factors for temporary night duty relaxation to airlines
items.summary: The DGCA has granted airlines temporary exemptions from new night duty limits for pilots, allowing three landings between 12 AM and 6 AM under specific conditions. These transitional measures aim to ensure operational stability while safety is maintained, with a review scheduled in six months.

items.title: CCPA asks Ola Electric for comments on alleged violation of customer rights
items.summary: The CCPA has also fixed a hearing on November 10; company in the process of obtaining legal advice

items.title: Govt to allocate gold quota under trade pact with UAE through bidding process
items.summary: India will now allocate tariff rate quotas for gold imports from the UAE through a competitive bidding process. This move aims to enhance transparency and efficiency. Eligible importers must be registered with the Bureau of Indian Standards for hallmarking and with GST.

items.title: Cognizant Q3 net income falls 53% to $274 million; revenue rises 7.3% to $5.4 billion
items.summary: Cognizant – which follows a January-December financial year– had posted a net income of $582 million in Q3 2024

items.title: Microsoft Azure and 365 down for thousands of users, Downdetector reports
items.summary: Microsoft services Azure and 365 were down for thousands of users on Wednesday. While Azure was not working for around 16,600 users, Microsoft 365 was down for around 9,000 users, Downdetector showed.

items.title: Samsung offers digital car key option for Mahindra’s electric origin cars XEV 9e, BE 6
items.summary: Mahindra becomes the first Indian OEM to integrate the Digital Car Key feature through Samsung Wallet

items.title: Coal India announces dividend of ₹10.25 per share; Q2 profit down 32% amid weak demand in favourable monsoon
items.summary: Coal India’s revenues also slipped 3.2% YoY alongside realisation from e-auctions declining 6.6%.

items.title: Coal gasification will help tap into deep-seated reserves: Kishan Reddy
items.summary: Of the 41 mines put to auction in the latest round, 21 mines hold potential for underground coal gasification.

items.title: L&T Q2 PAT up 15.6 % on strong order momentum
items.summary: The consolidated order-book of the group stood at ₹667,047 crore, representing a 15 per cent growth over March 2025

items.title: Centre revises dearness allowance rates for CPSE executives
items.summary: The revised rates apply to all five major pay scales and are based on the latest Consumer Price Index data.

items.title: MRPL wins Innovation Award at Energy Technology Meet
items.summary: The accolade acknowledges MRPL’s pioneering efforts in transforming crude oil into valuable petrochemicals, marking a significant milestone in India’s quest for energy innovation and sustainability

items.title: MoU signed with Gujarat maritime board for investment of Rs 17,000 crore
items.summary: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for a capital investment of Rs 17 thousand crores was signed by Gujarat Maritime Board and Gujarat Pipavav Port Limited (APM Terminals) in Gandhinagar on Wednesday in the inspiring presence of Chief Minister Patel and AP Moller-Maersk Board Chairman Robert Maersk Ugla.

items.title: AI chipmaker Nvidia is first $5-trillion company
items.summary: In comparison, Nvidia’s value is greater than the GDP of India, Japan and the United Kingdom, according to the International Monetary Fund

items.title: Commerce Minister Goyal meets exporters to discuss growth prospects
items.summary: Exporters want affordable, accessible export credit; predictability in policies, trade facilitation

items.title: Piyush Goyal asks electronics cos to boost manufacturing, cut import dependence
items.summary: India is setting its sights on revolutionizing its electronics manufacturing landscape. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has called for a surge in domestic production throughout the electronics value chain, aiming to cultivate self-sufficiency and reduce reliance on imports.

items.title: L&T orders signal return of private capex
items.summary: L&amp;T has also decided to exit its loss-making Hyderabad Metro project, and enter electronics manufacturing in select sectors

items.title: Why is Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang headed to South Korea ahead of Donald Trump-Xi Jinping meeting?
items.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is headed to South Korea amid the ASEAN Summit and US President Donald Trump's upcoming meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping. Here's why…

items.title: RBI’s forex strategy yields better results than IMF approach, says deputy governor Poonam Gupta
items.summary: Reserve Bank of India deputy governor Poonam Gupta defended the central bank's currency management strategy. She stated that building foreign exchange reserves and intervening in the currency market yield better outcomes. Gupta also indicated that there is scope for easing monetary policy. This is due to growth being below aspirations and inflation remaining benign.

items.title: L&T Q2 net profit rises 16% to ₹3,926 crore
items.summary: We have reached an in-principle understanding with the Government of Telangana for the divestment of its stake in L&T Metro Rail (Hyderabad): CMD

items.title: Vedanta to scale up $1 bn investment plan for Konkola Copper Mines in Zambia for developing new facilities, says CEO
items.summary: The funding will develop multiple facilities to extract copper from secondary waste, capitalizing on KCM's deposits and strong global copper price forecasts.

items.title: Why AI-led layoffs are bad not just for the laid off: Big reality check coming for Indian economy
items.summary: India's tech sector faces a concerning trend of silent layoffs, potentially impacting over 50,000 jobs this year, alongside overt dismissals. This slowdown risks India's consumption-driven economy, as IT employees are key consumers. While AI poses job displacement risks, it also offers potential for millions of new roles through reskilling and R&D.

items.title: Uncertainties impacting travel demand can't derail us, says Air India chief
items.summary: Air India faces significant challenges. The airline anticipates a Rs 4,000 crore loss from Pakistan's airspace closure. Global trade, peace, and politics create uncertainty. Unprecedented events like a plane crash and regional conflicts impact operations. Despite these headwinds, Air India's chief asserts the airline will not be derailed. The focus remains on becoming a world-class global airline.

items.title: Cognizant explores India IPO, listing to make it India's 2nd largest IT company
items.summary: For now, only Bengaluru-based IT titans Infosys Ltd and Wipro Ltd have their shares listed in both the US and India, and an India listing would make Cognizant the third.

items.title: Reconstitution of NCLT Mumbai further delays Vedanta demerger; next hearing on November 12
items.summary: In a setback for Vedanta, the National Company Law Tribunal has delayed its demerger proceedings once more, rescheduling the hearing to November 12 due to changes in the tribunal's bench composition. This means the entire case will be revisited anew.

items.title: Godrej Housing Finance launches branch in Kolkata
items.summary: Godrej Housing Finance plans to deepen its presence across key markets in East and Northeast India over the coming quarters

items.title: Cognizant bullish on fresher hiring and signals non-linearity in revenue
items.summary: Through freshers working with AI tools, the company has reduced its cost of human capital, he said

items.title: RBI issues draft guidelines to aid faster cross-border inward payments
items.summary: The RBI has asked public feedback on the guidelines by November 19 and the directions shall be effective after six months

items.title: Karnataka minister Patil inaugurates RangSons Aerospace facility following tie-up with Boeing
items.summary: In a significant step for Karnataka's aerospace sector, Minister M B Patil inaugurated the new RangSons Aerospace facility in Mysuru. This exciting collaboration with Boeing positions the company at the forefront of innovation. During the event, the minister proudly distributed certificates to ITI graduates who received specialized training at the facility, highlighting RangSons' commitment to excellence that meets global standards.

items.title: Aakash shareholders approve increase in authorised share capital following NCLAT nod
items.summary: The proposal was earlier recommended by the Board of Directors at its meeting held on October 4

items.title: Varun Beverages surges 9% on Carlsberg deal despite poor Q2 India show
items.summary: Prolonged monsoons result in flat volumes in the September quarter for the PepsiCo bottler.

items.title: NMDC Steel Q2 loss narrows to  ₹114 crore
items.summary: NMDC Steel on Wednesday reported narrowing of net loss to  ₹114.78 crore for September quarter FY26, driven by increase in revenues.

items.title: India-EU FTA: 10 out of 20 chapters concluded, 4-5 more ‘broadly decided’, says Piyush Goyal
items.summary: On whether FTA negotiations would be completed by the end of the year - a target set by PM Modi and EU Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen in February - Minister says the priority is a ‘good deal’ rather than meeting deadlines

items.summary: “Through BIRC 2025, we aim to build a future where Indian farmers, exporters, and innovators move forward together—creating value for the economy while protecting the planet”

items.title: Robust, globally competitive manufacturing sector key to raise share in GDP: Niti report
items.summary: India needs a strong manufacturing sector to reach 25% GDP contribution and create 100 million jobs. NITI Aayog's report highlights the need for advanced manufacturing to achieve this.  This roadmap aims to make India an advanced manufacturing powerhouse by 2035.  Frontier technologies will build precision and resilience.  This will create a globally competitive 'Made in India' identity.

items.title: Mehli Mistry’s fall from grace: From Ratan Tata’s ally to exile
items.summary: Mehli Mistry’s dramatic fall from Ratan Tata’s ally to exile highlights a tumultuous year within Tata Trusts.

items.title: SBI arm, ICRISAT launch SMART-CROP project
items.summary: Supported by the SBI Foundation’s LEAP programme, this project will use satellite imaging, remote sensing, and AI/ML analytics to provide real-time crop stress monitoring

items.title: Varun Beverages forays in alcoholic drinks segment
items.summary: The company’ board on Wednesday approved plans to add alcohol business to the main objects of the Memorandum of Association of the company

items.title: Despite fall in output, weak demand weighs on soybean price
items.summary: At 4.66 lakh tonnes, carry-forward stocks are 47% lower than a year ago

items.title: CA Institute proposes changes in Code of Ethics
items.summary: Draft updates rules on independence, fees, sustainability assurance, and practice partnerships

items.title: Reliance Brands brings Italian fashion brand Max & Co to India
items.summary: Part of the Max Mara Fashion Group, MAX & Co’s first store will open in Mumbai in early 2026 followed by a national roll-out in key metropolitan cities

items.title: RBI draft norms aim to speed up cross-border remittances, mandate same-day credit
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has proposed measures to speed up cross-border inward remittances, aiming for same-day credit to beneficiaries' accounts. Banks will be required to reconcile nostro accounts near real-time and implement straight-through processing for faster settlements, with new guidelines taking effect six months after finalization.

items.title: Policybazaar parent's sequential growth eases even as Q2 revenue rises 20%
items.summary: The revenue growth was aided by sale of new insurance plans and renewals, and credit disbursals. Profit after tax stood at  ₹135 crore,&nbsp;up 58% sequentially and 165% year-on-year.

items.title: From behind the screen to centre stage: Freelance content editors cash in
items.summary: India's creator economy is thriving, with freelance editors becoming essential as demand for professional video editing rises. Platforms like Vyro facilitate connections between creators and editors, emphasizing the growing importance of editing in content creation.

items.title: GREW Solar to expand module capacity to 11 GW at Jaipur
items.summary: With an existing 6.5 GW PV module facility in Dudu (Jaipur), Grew Solar is expanding capacity to 11 GW, alongside an 8 GW PV cell facility in Narmadapuram (Madhya Pradesh), the solar PV manufacturer said

items.title: NMDC PAT up 33 % at ₹1,694 cr in Q2
items.summary: Production up 23 %  p.c., and sales up 10 % p.c. in Q2

items.title: Furniture company HTL International plans expansion, to double revenue in 3 years
items.summary: HTL Group’s strategy focuses on filling the significant void in India’s premium furniture segment, positioning itself between mass brands and luxury categories

Coal Ministry launches 14th round of commercial auctions

items.title: Net profit of National Seeds Corp surges 51% to ₹110 crore
items.summary: NSC, a ‘B’-Mini Ratna Category-I company, has reported a total revenue (from all operations) of ₹1,367.43 crore in FY25, up by 15.6 per cent from ₹1,182.48 crore in the previous year

items.title: Building construction, clean energy driving copper demand: International Copper Association of India report
items.summary: India's copper demand surged by 9.3% to 1878 kilotonnes in FY25. Large-scale projects in building construction and infrastructure fueled this growth. The clean energy transition and consumer durables also contributed significantly. Policies promoting renewables and infrastructure development are key drivers. India is also increasing its use of recycled copper to meet demand and ensure future resilience.

items.title: U.S., Singapore accounted for one-third of FDI during FY25: RBI census
items.summary: Over three-fourths of the companies that reported inward direct investment were subsidiaries of foreign companies (single foreign investor holding more than 50% of total equity)

items.title: Coal India Q2 net falls 32% at ₹4262.64 crore as Ebitda skids
items.summary: The single largest coal producer in the world had posted a net profit of Rs ₹6274.80 crore in the second quarter of last fiscal.

items.title: Air India CEO promises internal improvements in first public comment after the deadly crash in June
items.summary: Air India also faces delayed jet deliveries and airspace closures due to geopolitical tensions, which have weighed on its performance as it strives to recover from the crash

items.title: Five-Star Business Finance profit up 7% in Q2FY26
items.summary: Assets under Management (AUM) as of September 2025 ended at ₹12,847 Cr, growth of 18% on YoY basis and 3% on QoQ basis

items.title: DP World signs agreement with Deendayal Port, Nevomo for magrail project
items.summary: DP World will leverage the European deep-tech company Nevomo’s proprietary MagRail Booster technology to demonstrate its use in a live Indian port environment

items.title: With a plane delivered a week, Air India catches up with fleet additions at Indigo
items.summary: Air India has begun receiving aircraft at the rate of one a week, equalling the additions at bigger rival IndiGo. With 524 planes yet to be delivered by 2031, the steady fleet expansion at the Tata-run airline augurs well for it—if, as an expert says, there are no supply disruptions from Boeing

items.title: Aviation ministry, AAI teams review proposal to upgrade Kishtwar airport
items.summary: A high-level team from the Ministry of Civil Aviation and Airports Authority of India visited Kishtwar. They reviewed the proposal to expand the Kishtwar airport under the UDAN scheme. The team conducted a ground assessment and met local officials. This visit is a step towards developing a full-fledged airport facility. The development promises round-the-year aircraft operations for Kishtwar.

items.title: India, China hold 23rd Corps Commander-Level talks to maintain peace along LAC
items.summary: The MEA noted that since the signing of the India–China Border Patrol Agreement in October 2024, “peace and stability have prevailed in the border regions”

items.title: Oroos Confectionery raises ₹20 crore in a funding round led by Fireside Ventures
items.summary: Oroos plans to establish a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility and expand its distribution network across tier-2 and tier-3 towns, aiming to tap into a consumer base of over 300 million

items.title: Samvardhana Motherson International appoints Gandharv Tongia as Gr CFO
items.summary: Auto components maker Samvardhana Motherson International Ltd has announced a key leadership change. Gandharv Tongia will become the new Group Chief Financial Officer starting November 15, 2025. He will take over from Kunal Malani, who is moving to lead Group Strategy and Transformation. Tongia brings over two decades of experience from prominent firms.

items.title: Vodafone Idea AGR relief applies only to the troubled telco: SC written order
items.summary: The written order clarifies that the Supreme Court’s observations apply only to the additional AGR demand raised by the telecom department against Vodafone Idea for the period up to 2016-17.

items.title: Commerce ministry launches coal analytics dashboard 'Koyla Shakti'
items.summary: The National Industrial Corridor Development Corporation has launched 'Koyla Shakti', a coal analytics dashboard for real-time monitoring. APEDA facilitated the air shipment of GI-tagged Indi and Puliyankudi limes to the UK. Additionally, the government is allowing eligible import-export code holders to create microsites on 'Source from India' platform starting November 1.

items.title: Hindustan Petroleum’s Q2 profit increases six-fold, announces ₹5 dividend
items.summary: Revenue from Operations also increased about 1% to more than ₹1.10 lakh crore

items.title: Early India–US defence procurement pact key to boosting Indian firms’ global access: SIDM Report
items.summary: The report suggests that SIDM could collaborate with the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) to develop globally compatible Indian defence standards

items.title: IIM Calcutta enters global top 10 in QS Executive MBA International Trade Rankings
items.summary: IIM Calcutta has achieved a significant global recognition. It secured the eighth position worldwide in the QS International Trade Rankings 2026 for Executive MBAs. This places IIM Calcutta at the forefront in India for this specialized program. The ranking highlights the institute's success in preparing executives for global trade challenges. The curriculum aligns with current industry demands.

items.title: Satyukt Analytics gets patent for its soil nitrogen estimation technology using satellite data
items.summary: The patented method enables accurate estimation of soil nitrogen content using satellite data reducing the need for costly and time-consuming field sampling

items.summary: Union Minister of State for Fisheries George Kurian will officially launch the initiative and a related national workshop at the ICAR-Central Marine Fisheries Research Institute (CMFRI) on Friday

items.summary: The US firm also set up the Ronald McDonald House programme, a foundation that provides essential services to children in Hyderabad

Global steel output down 1.6% in September

items.summary: Reliance Group accused corporate rivals of a malicious campaign to crash stock prices and acquire its assets, including BSES Ltd and Mumbai Metro

items.title: Himachal CM urges FM to increase additional borrowing limit for state by 2 pc
items.summary: In a strategic move to strengthen Himachal Pradesh's fiscal framework, Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu engaged with Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, advocating for a significant increase in the state's borrowing capacity. Additionally, he appealed to Union Minister Jitendra Singh to prioritize advanced weather monitoring technologies and the establishment of bio-manufacturing centers.

items.title: Air India to complete refurbishment of legacy Boeing 787s by mid-2027
items.summary: Air India is set to upgrade its fleet. Legacy Boeing 787-8 planes will be refurbished by mid-2027. Boeing 777 aircraft refurbishment will conclude by early 2028. New wide-body planes, including Dreamliners and A350s, will arrive regularly. This is part of a major transformation plan for the airline.

items.title: PNB Housing eyes growth in affordable housing, corporate loan segments, officials say
items.summary: HFC could appoint a new MD, CEO within a month; board extensively reviewed both internal and external candidate applications.

items.title: Govt to do away with green clearance for pilot projects for underground coal gasification
items.summary: The government will no longer require environmental clearance for pilot projects involving underground coal gasification. This move supports the nation's goal to gasify 100 million tonnes of coal by 2030. This technology can produce clean fuel and hydrogen. The coal ministry is also advancing a coal trading exchange and has launched two digital platforms for land acquisition and sector transparency.

items.title: Goyal to visit New Zealand next week for trade pact talks
items.summary: Next week, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will embark on a visit to New Zealand to engage in productive discussions surrounding a proposed free trade agreement. The goal of the negotiations is to bring the FTA to a robust conclusion, enhancing the rapidly growing bilateral trade between India and New Zealand.

items.title: SBI Mutual Fund invests ₹100 crore in Lenskart ahead of IPO
items.summary: Promoter Neha Bansal’s holding in the company will fall to 7.46 per cent.

items.summary: Investors attribute the momentum to a combination of macroeconomic stability, normalised valuations, and the rise of new tech-driven opportunities

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein believes India could emerge as a winner if the US economy enters a recession, given country’s unique economic resilience and strong domestic drivers. “The largest and the fifth-largest economies have in the past often been fairly independent of each other without strong linkages,” analyst at Bernstein said. Brokerage turned positive on India’s equity markets earlier this year after a cautious outlook in 2024, maintains that India’s macroeconomic recovery is already und

items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
items.summary: Investing.com -- Indian mutual funds should focus more on managing investor expectations rather than just chasing returns. Fund houses often overlook how retail investors react to market ups and downs, which affects long-term performance.

items.title: Avoid Indian equities, stay long on bonds
items.summary: Investing.com -- Investors should steer clear of Indian equities as corporate profits are set to shrink, and economic growth is expected to decelerate.

items.title: Bernstein says 'buy selectively' on Indian equities for 2025
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein says “buy selectively” on Indian equities for 2025, given macroeconomic challenges and earnings misses. It projects the Nifty 50 to reach 26,500 by the end of the year, a 12% return.
